articles.title: How We Picked the 2020 ‘Places to Go’ List
articles.description: There are so many places in the world, and only 52 spots. How do we choose? (Do you know all the synonyms for “argue”?)
articles.content:
52 Places to Go in 2020 is here. Read the full list now.
Where would you go if you could go anywhere?
That was the question I posed to the members of The Times Travel desk back at the beginning of September, at our kickoff lunch for the 2020 edition of our … [+1004 chars]

articles.title: For William Gibson, Seeing the Future Is Easy. But the Past?
articles.description: “Alternate history, in my opinion, is a more demanding game,” says the author of “Agency” and other science fiction novels, “if only because conventional historical fiction, like history, is itself highly speculative.”
articles.content:
Has a book ever brought you closer to another person, or come between you?
Anything J. G. Ballard ever wrote, surely, has done both, countless times. At the start of my career, before anyone had ever uttered cyberpunk as a literary term, mentioning Ballards … [+2439 chars]
